content: four-legged sheep crochet pattern skill level advanced beginner requires ❖ #6 super bulky blanket yarn ❖ fiberfill stuffing color blue 65-85 yards 90-100g ❖ yarn needle ❖ #4 medium yarn worsted weight ❖ scissors color white 25-35 yards 15-20g ❖ stitch marker ❖ #4 medium yarn worsted weight ❖ 6 00mm j crochet hook color blue 6-12 yards 4-8g ❖ 4 00mm g crochet hook ❖ small black crochet thread for the eyes the medium yarn i used and that s pictured is bernat super value 100% acrylic yarn in white and hot blue the super bulky is bernat b lanket in the color busy blue 100% polyester yarn note that this pattern is meant to be made with super bulky blanket yarn and medium yarn and the 2 different size hooks and if your yarn and hook choices deviate from the pattern too much the sheep will probably not turn out as the pattern intends but if you re making this sheep with different size yarn adjust hook sizes as well 1 copyright mysimplicitiesbymn 2025 all rights my patterns for commercial purposes thank you for respecting copyright laws abbreviations us terms ml…… magic loop or magic_ring r 1…… row or round number single_crochet…… single_crochet 1 …… the number of stitches in the finished row or round half_double_crochet…… half-double_crochet bold lettering…… the stitch to do for that double_crochet…… double_crochet round slip_stitch…… slip_stitch the stitches between brackets → is the sequence of stitches to repeat the increase…… increase 2 stitches in 1 space indicated amount of times decrease…… decrease invisible decrease x1…… the necessary amount of times to decrease…… single_crochet 2 together repeat a sequence of stitches st…… stitch or stitches fasten_off…… cut the working yarn and pull through the loop and pull tight chain…… chain additional information is in colored parenthesis note when a row has a color or particular yarn at the beginning of a row - that s the yarn color for that row and the following row until a color change is indicated sometimes to help differentiate a yarn or hook change there will be colored font to change colors for single_crochet insert hook into next stitch yarn over and pull up a loop there should be 2 loops on the hook yarn over with new color and pull through both loops and continue pattern make sure to keep the gauge tight for both yarns during the color change so the stitch isn t loose once you color change you can fasten_off other color note all parts of the sheep are worked in the round - crochet in continuous rounds without a slip_stitch + chain at the beginning of each round simply end each round with single_crochet or whatever stitch is indicated for the pattern and move the stitch marker up and continue the pattern
